and so on with all the GPU instances right above that we have the platform
layer which is for data scientists they want to focus on the algorithms but
don't want to do the infrastructure part of it so we've got what we call sage maker that makes it really easy for you

top layer we have what we call as application services which are API based services where the developer doesn't

to be focusing on all the language based services in that space so we're going to

reasonable intelligence from audio because it's so hard to process digital
audio what you need to do is first convert that into text because once it
is in text you can extract things like customer insights you can do things like closed
captioning and the possibilities of what you can do with it increase so we launched what we call
Amazon transcribe which is a fully managed continuously trained automatic speech recognition service that takes an
audio and generates a text transcript for you you will notice that I stress on
the words fully managed and continuously trained the reason is that for all these
services we've invested a lot in this continuous improvement right because
with artificial intelligence and machine learning you need to continuously keep training in order to keep up with
changes that are happening in the language as well as to keep increasing the accuracy to handle you know
difficult use cases like noisy audio our you know far-field microphones where you
know speakers not close to the mic and the quality of audio is not so strong
and so on the features that we have
today we transcribe our ability to detect multiple speakers there we can
say a speaker one said the speaker two said this again speaker said this speaker one senses and so on customer
Cavallari because no matter how accurate our speech recognition is you're always gonna have terms that are specific to
your domain whether it's insurance or finance that may be the speech
recognition engine doesn't get right so you can load those words up as a customer Cavallari to bump up the
accuracy for your speech recognition we support a wide range of audio quality
and we're especially accurate on low quality telephony audio because we know
that a lot of our customers are sitting on millions of minutes of telephony
audio that they've recorded but they're not able to analyze because it's cost prohibitive so we've taken a lot of pain
to trained specifically for 8 kilohertz audio because you know on the telephone line not all the information you're able
to store so sampling rate as 8 kilohertz versus 16 or even higher for other sorts of audio
we are integrated with Amazon s3 so if you have all your files on s3 you just
point transcribe to your files we generate the transcript and just a couple of weeks ago we launched new
feature where you can also specify the s3 bucket where we should put the transcripts in so we'll just put that
back into your own bucket so it's completely secure you own the data timestamps in confidence scores so very
able to give you timestamp for every word as well as the confidence score so if you have workflows where let's say
closed captioning where you want the text to be perfect so you would take the
output from transcribe and then give it to a human and then they could focus just on the low confidence words so that
the time they take for post editing is drastically reduced punctuation again
there's a lot of engines out there that gives you just plain text we give you punctuated text which makes it much more
easy to read and consume that text right when you have full staffs and capitals
and so on we support both English and Spanish and today we're launching
availability in two additional regions sydney and canada so if you have
